prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. 1. Define the coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] 2. Create 2D sketch face_1: 1. Draw the first line from Point (0.0, 0.0) to Point (0.227, 0.0). 2. Draw the second line from Point (0.227, 0.0) to Point (0.75, 0.0). 3. Draw the third line from Point (0.75, 0.0) to Point (0.75, 0.125). 4. Draw the fourth line from Point (0.75, 0.125) to Point (0.125, 0.125). 5. Draw the fifth line from Point (0.125, 0.125) to Point (0.125, 0.25). 6. Draw the sixth line from Point (0.125, 0.25) to Point (0.0, 0.25). 7. Close the loop by drawing the seventh line from Point (0.0, 0.25) to Point (0.0, 0.0). 3. Draw 2D sketch face_2: 1. Draw a line from Point (0.125, 0.125) to Point (0.75, 0.125). 2. Draw a line from Point (0.75, 0.125) to Point (0.125, 0.25). 3. Close the loop by drawing a line from Point (0.125, 0.25) to Point (0.125, 0.125). 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D by rotating it using the specified Euler angles and translating it via the given translation vector. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model by an amount of 0.375 units in the normal direction. 7. Perform a NewBodyFeatureOperation to create the final part. The final part has a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.375 units, and a height of 0.75 units. This part will serve as the base for the next part(s).</description>
